purpose.summary: This is an IMS Program Specification Block (PSB) definition file that generates PSBPAUTL for assembler language. It defines a single database PCB named PAUTLPCB accessing DBDNAME=DBPAUTP0 with PROCOPT=L (language interface) and KEYLEN=14. The PCB senses root segment PAUTSUM0 (PARENT=0) and child segment PAUTDTL1 (PARENT=PAUTSUM0).

inputs.name: PAUTSUM0
inputs.description: Root segment (PARENT=0) sensed in PCB PAUTLPCB for database DBPAUTP0

inputs.name: PAUTDTL1
inputs.description: Child segment (PARENT=PAUTSUM0) sensed in PCB PAUTLPCB for database DBPAUTP0

business_rules.description: Defines IMS segment hierarchy for PCB access: PAUTSUM0 as root segment (PARENT=0), PAUTDTL1 as dependent child segment of PAUTSUM0
business_rules.logic_summary: Specified via SENSEG statements in the PCB definition

open_questions.question: What IMS application programs use this PSB (PSBPAUTL)?
open_questions.context: PSB definition does not specify calling programs
open_questions.suggestion: Check JCL, COBOL programs, or IMS system definitions for PSB usage

open_questions.question: Specific business purpose of DBPAUTP0 database and segments PAUTSUM0/PAUTDTL1?
open_questions.context: Names suggest Payment Authority Utility (PAUT), but no descriptive comments
open_questions.suggestion: Review DBD source or application documentation
